intro: Neopometia lactescens, commonly known as the white-flowered milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they are arranged in clusters. Neopometia lactescens is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
